name: OSC sender
description: Sends a message via OSC to a specified IP, port, and address. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from pythonosc.udp_client import SimpleUDPClient


class CustomComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Custom OSC Component"
    description = "Sends a message via OSC to a specified IP, port, and address."
    documentation: str = "http://docs.axiestudio.org/components/custom"
    icon = "code"
    name = "CustomComponent"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Input Value",
            info="This is a custom component Input",
            value="Hello, World!",
            tool_mode=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="osc_address",
            display_name="OSC Address",
            info="The OSC address path (e.g., /test).",
            value="/test",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="osc_port",
            display_name="OSC Port",
            info="The port number of the OSC receiver.",
            value="9000",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="osc_ip",
            display_name="OSC IP Address",
            info="The IP address of the OSC receiver.",
            value="127.0.0.1",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

    def build_output(self) -> Data:
        # Retrieve the OSC IP, address, and port
        osc_ip = self.osc_ip.strip()
        osc_address = self.osc_address.strip()
        osc_port = int(self.osc_port.strip())

        # Validate OSC address
        if not osc_address.startswith("/"):
            raise ValueError("OSC Address must start with '/'.")

        # Validate OSC port
        if not (1 <= osc_port <= 65535):
            raise ValueError("OSC Port must be between 1 and 65535.")

        # Validate OSC IP
        if not self._is_valid_ip(osc_ip):
            raise ValueError(f"Invalid OSC IP Address: {osc_ip}")

        # Create the OSC client
        client = SimpleUDPClient(osc_ip, osc_port)

        # Send the message via OSC
        try:
            client.send_message(osc_address, self.input_value)
            result = f"Message sent to {osc_ip}:{osc_port} at {osc_address}: {self.input_value}"
        except Exception as e:
            raise RuntimeError(f"Error sending message via OSC: {str(e)}")

        return result

    @staticmethod
    def _is_valid_ip(ip: str) -> bool:
        """
        Validates an IPv4 address.
        """
        parts = ip.split(".")
        if len(parts) != 4:
            return False
        for part in parts:
            try:
                if not 0 <= int(part) <= 255:
                    return False
            except ValueError:
                return False
        return True

code.value:
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from pythonosc.udp_client import SimpleUDPClient


class CustomComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Custom OSC Component"
    description = "Sends a message via OSC to a specified IP, port, and address."
    documentation: str = "http://docs.axiestudio.org/components/custom"
    icon = "code"
    name = "CustomComponent"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Input Value",
            info="This is a custom component Input",
            value="Hello, World!",
            tool_mode=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="osc_address",
            display_name="OSC Address",
            info="The OSC address path (e.g., /test).",
            value="/test",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="osc_port",
            display_name="OSC Port",
            info="The port number of the OSC receiver.",
            value="9000",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="osc_ip",
            display_name="OSC IP Address",
            info="The IP address of the OSC receiver.",
            value="127.0.0.1",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

    def build_output(self) -> Data:
        # Retrieve the OSC IP, address, and port
        osc_ip = self.osc_ip.strip()
        osc_address = self.osc_address.strip()
        osc_port = int(self.osc_port.strip())

        # Validate OSC address
        if not osc_address.startswith("/"):
            raise ValueError("OSC Address must start with '/'.")

        # Validate OSC port
        if not (1 <= osc_port <= 65535):
            raise ValueError("OSC Port must be between 1 and 65535.")

        # Validate OSC IP
        if not self._is_valid_ip(osc_ip):
            raise ValueError(f"Invalid OSC IP Address: {osc_ip}")

        # Create the OSC client
        client = SimpleUDPClient(osc_ip, osc_port)

        # Send the message via OSC
        try:
            client.send_message(osc_address, self.input_value)
            result = f"Message sent to {osc_ip}:{osc_port} at {osc_address}: {self.input_value}"
        except Exception as e:
            raise RuntimeError(f"Error sending message via OSC: {str(e)}")

        return result

    @staticmethod
    def _is_valid_ip(ip: str) -> bool:
        """
        Validates an IPv4 address.
        """
        parts = ip.split(".")
        if len(parts) != 4:
            return False
        for part in parts:
            try:
                if not 0 <= int(part) <= 255:
                    return False
            except ValueError:
                return False
        return True
